_prev_prog_3.EquipmentTested: Compressors, Evaporators, Evaporative Condensor, Motors, Pressure Vessels, pumps, Piping, Pressure Safety Valves
_prev_prog_3.Description: Josephs Gourmet Pasta has contracted with Northeast Distributors to "Develop" a Web Based PSM/RMP Program that will minimize the potential for an un-intentional ammonia release from their refrigeration systems; and will comply with the regulatory requirements of EPA CFR 40 Part 68.  Volume 2 of their program describes in detail the responsibilities each Manager and Operator has for Developing, Implementing, and Integrating each prevention element of the EPA RMP regulation into the way that Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. manages its ammonia systems.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
I. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY POLICIES

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. (JGP) recognizes management's responsibility in protecting it's employees, equipment, property, and the environment from a harmful ammonia release. The safety and health of all personnel are very important. The control of an ammonia release incidents has been and will continue to be the basic responsibility of all Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. personnel who operate the Ammonia Refrigeration System.

The Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. PSM/RMP program assigns and documents the specific responsibilities for developing, implementing and integrating the OSHA PSM and the EPA RMP standards into its Ammonia Operating and Management Systems. The Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. PSM/RMP program focuses attention on "Making PSM/RMP the way we manage our ammonia based refrigeration system" rather than a project we expect to complete and put on the shelf when the filing date has passed.

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. believes that close coordination between their employees and our Refrigeration Contractor, Northeast Distributors (NED), is the key to a successful PSM/RMP program. NED employees have been deeply involved and they (along with out designated Maintenance Employees) Operators) assume the major responsibility for operating the Hazardous Material process safely.

The Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. Emergency action Plan has been developed in cooperation, and with the support of the local Public Emergency Response Agency. All Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. employees have received documented Ammonia Awareness training.


II. STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. operates an Ammonia Refrigeration System.  Ammonia is a common industrial chemical with applications in a large number of industries such as Agriculture, Water Treatment, Food Storage Warehouses, Pharmaceuticals, Heat Treating and many, many more. Ammonia has been listed by both EPA and OSHA as a Hazardous Substance.


III.

SUMMARY OF WORST CASE AND ALTERNATIVE RELEASE SCENARIOS

Dispersion cloud modeling studies have been performed as required by EPA RMP regulation and the information developed has been used in the preparation of the Technical Studies and Reports that are also required.  The information is considered to be sensitive but is available from the Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. general offices Haverhill, MA on a need to know basis.

IV. DESCRIPTION OF THE JOSEPHS GOURMET PASTA ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM


Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. conducts annual in house Ammonia Awareness training and strives to maintain a relationship the local Fire Department y to practice and update their Emergency action Program.

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. conducts a Triennial PSM/RMP progress audit of their PSM/RMP program to (1) Identify strengths and weaknesses to facilitate program improvements, and (2) verify compliance with the PSM/RMP regulations.

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. considers the PSM/RMP manuals to be ?living" documents that must be updated and revised regularly to maintain their viability and usefulness.

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. emphasizes and insists on Cooperation between the NED  ammonia process operators and the JGP maintenance operators in all aspects of the development, implementation, and integration of their PSM/RMP program.

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. provides a comprehensive, computer based, user friendly training  and tracking program and management system with designated teacher involvement in specific training modules for each employee involved with the ammonia  process.

Josephs Gourmet Pasta Co. maintains a pro-active "open-door" policy toward neighbors and concerned community citizens.  Facility tours and risk management discussions are scheduled and conducted upon written request.


V. FIVE YEAR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE HISTORY

There have been no releases of ammonia during the past five years that resulted in an injury, or that had an off-site impact, or that resulted

in significant property damage either on-site or off-site.


VI. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Facility employees have been trained to respond to accidental ammonia releases through Ammonia Awareness and Emergency Action training.  The site emergency action plan has been coordinated with local Public Emergency Responders.
